alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued June 23 at 3:06PM MST until June 23 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 306 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 6 miles west of Sun Lakes to near Blackwater, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 155 and 174. US Highway 60 between mile markers 173 and 216. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 154 and 173. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Apache Junction, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, East Mesa, Queen Creek, Gold Camp, Lost Dutchman State Park, Goldfield, San Tan Village Mall, Seville and Freestone Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
